title: Just so people know...
comment: This game is a Rougelike. "Roguelike is a subgenre of role-playing video games, characterized by procedural level generation, turn-based gameplay, tile-based graphics, permanent death of the player-character, and typically based on a high fantasy narrative setting." it isn't meant to have a save feature it be easy. It's supposed to rely on part luck and part skill to complete. The devs have created a wonderful modification of the original. Don't ever change the game because people don't understand it.

I figuered it was normal and continued on, except that it would not go away I went through another whole floor and It didn't leave, I healed, I ate food, and I used my dew vile, but none of it would save my poor warrior

Hey, you can always contact me at Evan@shatteredpixel.com

This isn't a bug though, caustic ooze is washed away in water and other than that you cannot get rid of it. When its first applied to you the game log lets you know this, and you can also tap the buff icon to read its description.

title: The mage nerf is a curse
comment: When I start becoming afraid of even two rats , then is when we know you've gone too far. I've played this and pixel dungeon for a year now, and I like to think i'm pretty good. But this nerf is terrible. We now have a tier 0 weapon. The staff. It is neither accurate, nor has any substantial damage. I think you tried to make battlemage more viable, but went too far.

The staff is a terrible melee weapon and that's intentional. The purpose of the changes were to make the mage more reliant on using and conserving magic to better differentiate him from the other classes. Try hitting a rat with one shot and then leading them behind a door to finish with melee.

title: Floor 23
comment: Great game, love it but what is defined as light armor? Armor that you have excess strength for? Like say youre a rouge and you get plate armor and youre 2 strength lvls above it. Would that be considered' light'  or do you need to upgrade leather armor a ton?
Armor is 'light' when you have more strength than what's required to wear it. So every extra point is more lightness.

The second is that you implement something to do after beating the game. Maybe a hard mode, or boss rush, or new dungeon. I understand if these won't be implemented soon (Or at all), though I do think they'd improve gameplay experience. Thank you for your time, and have a wonderful day.

title: ∆∆∆GLITCH FOUND BY ME∆∆∆
comment: If you want huntress unlocked without actually unlocking it, highlight the rouge class and very quickly click load game, then hit the huntress before the screen goes black. You will spawn in as a huntress. To load your huntress up, do the same steps. To do a new huntress save, just do the same steps except click "new game" instead of "load game". Have fun :)

title: This isn't a RPG. Its a slot machine
comment: I've played this so many times without even getting past the third boss. You need great items but you need to be lucky and Get the best you can get but doing that is hard with Hunger making you go. Overall too random to play for me.

Luck does play a significant factor, it determines the best and worst outcome of a run, it's up to player's skill to see how close they get to the best outcome. Yes there are some runs where you are just going to die, but skilled players can beat the game quite consistently. If you feel like there's nothing you can do, try looking up a guide.

title: But
comment: Hello devs, as much as I like the game and it's added bonuses, it hurts that health potion farming is nerfed. Can you please reintroduce it? I just lost a successful run at level 7 with a +5 scale armour and warhammer because flies no longer give health potions. It's infuriating and most frustrating. Please consider. Thank you

Flies and other potion droppers do infact still drop health potions. Drops get steadily less likely as you get more, but this really only kicks in after a fair number of potions. The change was to combat people who would camp out until they built a huge stockpile. If you're finding few or no potions at all, that's just some old-fashioned bad luck.

title: Great little rogue-like; difficult
comment: I like this version better than the original: I find it a bit easier, more informative, and there's no degradation, thankfully. This game is tough and you'll lose, a lot. You need some luck to get good items. The hunger mechanic is harsh: you can't wander aimlessly. It's worth reading a guide so you understand the mechanics of the game (for example, you never miss enemies coming through a doorway: that's an easy way to hit wraiths and crabs). Overall, it's a great game if you like challenging rogue likes.

title: Cute Coffeebreak Roguelike
comment: This game provides a rather short, but cute, venture into the roguelike genre. The fundamentals are a good deal more simplified than Crawl or Nethack, which makes for a nice introduction into an otherwise often convoluted gaming experience. One thing that could be helped with this game is better in-game instructions/item descriptions. That Leather Armor of Viscosity is *not* sticky--it delays the damage delt (from the Pixel Dungeon wiki). Overall, a decent amount of fun.
Please, whatever you do, do not add degradation!!!
The recent update brings shattered up to date with vanilla PD, but degradation has been disabled.

title: Amazing game
comment: This game is great but I have an idea for it. You should make it so when you level up you go back to max health and all debuffs are removed. Tell me what you think of this and why or why not you should put it in.

This is common in RPGs, but consider that the player levels up about once a floor. Getting a full heal that often would make the player much stronger, so the game would need to be re-balanced. You would need to keep track of exp/hp, so you level when low on health, and health potions would be less useful. I don't think the game would be more fun.

You expect me to invest time into a game that has no consistensy whatsoever? And I know what roguelike game means, but now this is just ridiculous. Dark souls is easier.

The crab is very consistent, you must hit it with surprise attacks or it will block you, it is specifically design to explain that mechanic. Even if the crab is frozen, if it's had the time to raise its claw it'll be blocking. Try reading the sign on the floor the crab appears on(floor 4) if you don't know how to surprise attack.

comment: The game has a fantastic challenge and a wonderful sense of satisfaction when defeating each boss... However I hope that the game adds more weapons, more types of rooms and perhaps companion NPCs to help us players. Nonetheless I'm still very impressed by the game and I hope that this good work will continue!
No farming? Ok fair enough but then no 5 stars either. Don't take away our freedom to play this game the way we -the players- see fit.

My goal is to do what is best for the game, which is not always the same as what everyone wants. Farming potions let players exchange time (not a game resource) for health potions (a very valuable resource) as much as they wanted. This was clearly overpowered, so it was nerfed. Health potion drops aren't removed though, you can still find plenty.

title: Unplayable
comment: It takes, on average, about 1.5 to 2 items worth of food to fully explore a level. Such food items drop, on average, slightly less than once per level. You will always starve to death, not just before you can win, but before you can even make meaningful progress. Worst of all, the game's designers then *explicitly* tell you, via in game signs, to make sure to take your time on each level, to be strong enough for the next one, which, if you take their advice, burns through even more food. There is no excuse for this.

title: I like the original better.
comment: I like this game. The enhancements in here are nice; and this is certainly an excellent mod; but I still like the original PD better. This version has some excellent ideas (I especially liked the rogue's cloak), but the original does a better job of balancing weapons and abilities, meeting closer at the happy medium between difficulty and playability. Also, this version doesn't have Google+ cloud saving. This is by no means a bad game, you will like it if you like the original, I just prefer the original.

title: Why is the Hunter so bad though?
comment: I adore the game, probably the best thing you can download on the market by far! However, you have to go through a lot to unlock the Hunter, you'd expext her to be cool right? Nope, she's just a shittier Rogue. I've been trying to get to Tengu with her to get the prestige book thing, hoping she gets some kind of cool power from that, but it's impossible! Do us all a favour either buff the class or replace it please.

In the original PD classes were more of a difficulty selection, I plan to make classes more about strategic diversity in Shattered PD. This means buffing weaker classes and generally giving every class more tools to play with. Currently the rogue has benefited the most with his new cloak of shadows, the other classes will get their turns too.

title: Good additions to the original - but one noticable bug
comment: Last night when I left the game, I was at depth 9, and had some new items (level 3 runestone, nature shoes) - and when I fired the game up again, even though the load option indicated the correct depth, when I loaded, I was on level 6 and had lost all items I'd acquired below that depth - and the seed bag was no longer for sale at the shop.

This has been reported to me infrequently for a little while now and I haven't yet been able to isolate the root cause. The current save system is less than helpful for hunting down bugs like these. For the next update I am internally reworking parts of saving, which should make these issues much easier to pinpoint and fix. Sorry for the trouble.

title: Great fun, but extremely vexing...
comment: First things first, you should definitely get this game! It's engaging, very fun, challenging, and addictive, which is exactly what most folks look for in a game. The fact that it's free is icing on the cake. The interface is streamlined very well and you can tell a lot of thought and effort was put into this mod of an already awesome game. I'm giving it 5 stars, but I do have some comments...  Having run through dozens of times, I'm realizing I'll most likely never get to see even half of what's on offer here. I understand these types of games are going to be hard, but this one is pretty brutal. Most of the items you will need to succeed just don't materialize. I walk around a majority of the time with a pack full of unidentified items, starving to death, with almost no health... Again, I know that's the intent...  But then I win the lottery on a playthrough and the game showers you with identify scrolls, health potions, food, and vegetation early on. Then I realized, being good at this game is not near as important as what random stuff the engine gives you... And that is discouraging...

Could be a bit easier. Die a LOT, but still a lot of fun.

title: Increase food amounts
comment: 9/10 times I die is due to starving to low hp then gettin hit by enemies. The amounts of food in the game needs to go up, its rare you find more then 1, food item per floor and that's ridiculous when you need at least 2 per floor, and most of the enemies you fight are edible, so why can't they drop food more often?

Like most resources in Pixel Dungeon, you need to manage food well to succeed. Health is more important than hunger, and if you are at or near full HP and starving there is often no reason to eat just yet. If you're more sparing with your food you might find it lasts you a lot longer.

title: Very nice!
comment: Almost every change you made to the original game is for the best. At first I was skeptical about the artifacts, but they are actually quite nice, epecially those that don't simply charge over time. If I had to make suggestions I would love to see the wands rebalanced and the boomerang tweaked. The main reason I gave 4 stars rather than 5 is the change to the wheightstone: I liked the accuracy buff, and i don't see why the wheightstone can't offer 3 choices.

The main reason I dumped accuracy is because it's a stat with no real gameplay potential. On most runs you can strategize and build your equipment/character to take advantage of speed or damage (e.g. enchantment proccing/comboing with speed, or ambushing with damage), but accuracy doesn't have this nearly as much.

title: A stellar effort.
comment: I love the original PD more than most, I'll just put that out there. Shattered PD takes what was already great and runs with it. The balance tweaks are small, but significant, primarily the Dew Vial nerf, which is one of the most elegant fixes I think was possible.   If you're good at PD, Shattered PD takes away all the best grinding opportunities and forces your game to keep moving. If you're bad at PD, Shattered PD rebalances the characters to make the early game less luck-based.   Play it. It's good.

title: Bug

This is an issue a few people have reported, but I have not been able to reproduce. Make sure that you aren't missing any hidden doors. Also if you run into an extra locked rooms, make sure there isn't a pit you can jump into from above to get to it. Pits were a new room type added in source version 1.7.1 that a lot of people get confused about.

title: Found a bug!
comment: I was playing normally but had to stop after a while (got to depth 12), so I pressed "Exit pixel dungeon" and it didn't save my game! I personally think this is a huge problem, if the game won't save then there's almost no point in trying to get long runs since some people can't waste so much time on the game in one session and have to do it over multiple sessions.

I'm very sorry you're having an issue. This is a fairly obscure bug and I haven't been able to reproduce it. I want to get this fixed but I need information, please email me and describe your run to me and what you were doing in PD just before you exited. This kind of information is absolutely crucial in fixing the bug.

title: Love the game....but
comment: I play on Android, there is no way to back out of rankings, badges, and also no menu button while in game. Every time you die you must close out the app and restart it, same goes for checking rank and badges.

You need to use the back button on your phone in this case, this will give exactly the functionality you're asking for. 

If you don't have a back button, Vanilla Pixel Dungeon does have ingame buttons for this as of its latest version, so those buttons will eventually reached Shattered too.

title: Why

title: Ehh overpowered
